result.execSummary:
The defendant Deshawn L Peterson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Armed Robbery [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Keep separate and have no contact with co-defendant Joseph Carter.
Credit for 3 days time served.

superMiscConds.notes: No controlled substances or alcohol; urine screens. No contact with the victim, Debria M. No contact with the K-Mart located at 3201 North Mayfair Road, city of Wauwatosa and county of Milwaukee. No contact with co-defendant Jopseh Carter.
Seek and maintain employment. Be given job and vocational training. Parenting classes/counseling. Cognitive thinking intervention counseling.
Pay balances remaining of the surcharges, costs and disbursements. Failure to pay would result in a civil judgment entered against defendant, which is non-dischargable in bankruptcy.

supervisions.notes: Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program. Defendant is not eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.

Court ordered defendant to provide a DNA sample and pay the DNA surcharge, plus all costs, fees and disbursements from prison funds not to exceed 25%.  Balance to be paid while on extended supervision. Court set restitution at zero.

records.addlTxt: Justice Point report, received and filed.
Sentencing materials submitted on behalf of defendant, received and filed.
Letters of Support, submitted on behalf of defendant, received and filed.

Defendant Deshawn L Peterson in court with attorney Alejandro A. Lockwood.  Deann L. Heard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel requested additional time to submit his sentencing memorandum.  State takes no position.  Court granted defense request and ordered all terms and conditions of bail to continue.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 21, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Deshawn L Peterson in court with attorney Alejandro A Lockwood.  Jay R Pucek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  Defendant sworn.    Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, elements and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Information/Complaint. Judgment of conviction entered.  The Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon not to possess any firearms.    Court further advised defendant of voting ineligibility.  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 20 and that all terms and conditions of bail to continue.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 5, 2014 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
/in support of defendant, received and filed.
Justice Point Pretrial Report, filed.

Defendant Deshawn L Peterson in court with attorney Alejandro A Lockwood.  Jay R Pucek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Due to the lateness of the hour, and the unavailability of both counsel in the afternoon, Court ordered case adjourned.  All terms and conditions of bail are ordered to continue.  Plea hearing scheduled for June 19, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
/from Justice Point, filed. rn

Defendant Deshawn L Peterson in court with attorney Alejandro A Lockwood.  James W Frisch appeared on behalf of Jay R. Pucek for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel requested a plea date.  Court ordered all terms and conditions of bail continue, and warned defendant to remain compliant with Justice Point.  Plea hearing scheduled for May 15, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point report, received and filed.

Defendant Deshawn L Peterson in court with attorney Alejandro A. Lockwood.  Jay R. Pucek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel unable to view DVD provided in discovery and requested another date to view same and determine how he and his client will proceed.    Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.  All conditions of bail continue.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 23, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Deshawn L Peterson in court with attorney Alejandro A. Lockwood.  Jay R. Pucek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Violation Report received and filed.  Court admonished defendant and warned that further violations would result in a change in bail.

Defense counsel requested another scheduling date to go over offer and additional discovery.  Court ordered case continued before Branch 20 and ordered all terms and conditions of bail to continue.
/of Discharge from Pretrial Supervision, received and filed. rn
Justice Point report received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.

Defendant Deshawn L Peterson in court with attorney Alejandro A. Lockwood.  James Frisch on behalf of Jay R. Pucek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for scheduling conference. Defense counsel requests short adjournment to speak to the State about this matter. State does not object.  Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed. Bail conditions continue. Case adjourned to Branch 20.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 27, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Deshawn L Peterson in court with attorney Alejandro A Lockwood.  Jay R. Pucek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Moroney, Branch 20.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 20.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 6, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with DEBRIA M.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for ENHANCED SUPERVISION.  Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription AND no dangerous weapons or firearms.
  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Deshawn L Peterson in court with attorney Alejandro A Lockwood.  Defendant Deshawn L Peterson in custody.  Kristin M Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge MORONEY, Branch 20.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 14, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
